channel.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
channel.description:
#Table of contents with links to posts.
Note: _menu: Help -> Library -> Community -> tiar_ contains examples that may help you understand how to use the objects: http://community.axoloti.com/uploads/default/optimized/2X/4/492801e0d2c544aa4123b58b92c29ab180ae9cb0_1_515x500.png
*In most objects, I have developed variants of [Differentiated Polynomial anti aliasing](http://stash.reaper.fm/28384/DifferentiatedPolynomialWaveTables.pdf). These methods are CPU efficient and strongly reduce digital artefacts. The resulting waveforms are smooth and without [Gibbs ringing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibbs_phenomenon). When a crisper sound is wanted I used Band Limited Impulses.*
-----
-----
----- ### tiar/artic * [sentence1](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/49) Sort of "smart" note counter. ------ ### tiar/conv/ * O2_to_SR_59 Converts an oversampled audio signal to sample rate with a 59 tap filter (decimator). Note: the oversampled signal consist of 2 interleaved sample rate signals. * O2_to_SR_Bellanger A 19 tap decimator. * SR_to_O2_6 A x2 interpolator based on a 6 tap filter (better frequency response than linear interpolation between 2 samples).
----- ### tiar/disp/ * scope An easy to use scope with improved sync _(bandpass and zero crossing detection)_
----- ### tiar/dist/ * [DPHardClip and DPSoftClip](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/5) A hard and a soft clipper. anti aliased by first order differentiated polynomial segments. * [SyncAlias](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/43) Low fi *Ã la* 8bit with a touch of *sync*...
----- ### tiar/filter/ * [Butt10](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/68) A tenth order brickwall filter to mimic early band limited digital synths. * [dis lphp1](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/71) A non linear filter reminiscent of waveshapers found in early String machines. * [ZDF SVF 1](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/39) A heavy duty filter capable of deep and fast modulations. Based on "step invariant" transform. * [ZDF SVF 2](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/42) A heavy duty filter capable of audio rate modulations.
----- ### tiar/fx/
* TripleVibrato
------ ### tiar/gain/
* [DCA](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/74) A very fast and declicked (zero crossing) amplifier.
------- ### tiar/kfilter
* [LPRiseDecay](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/38) It can be used to smooth control signals with distinct rising and falling rates. I find it useful on midi signals such as aftertouch. * [median](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/40) This is a 3 tap median filter for noisy-spiky control signals. * [hyst](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/67) A hysteresis comparator (Schmitt trigger) useful for switch debouncing.
------- ###tiar/kfunc * [modulo](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/75) A modulo function, useful to transform a range into segments or "synched" ramps. * [quant](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/80) A quantification function, with controllable steps. Useful for old digi synth recration. * [segment objects](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/79) A series of really handy segment functions. ------- ### tiar/lfo/ * [triphase_lfo and triphase_vlfo](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/4) A **low** and and a **very low** (cycle up to 64s) frequency oscillator. Each has three sine outputs in triphase. * [555LFO](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/47)Mimics waveforms found in some analog effects LFOs.
----- ### tiar/math/
* [tiar/math/DP *](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/8) This is an anti aliased ring modulator. ---- ### tiar/noise/
* [Geiger](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/76) ----- ### tiar/osc/
* [6coseg and 6coseg m](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/66) The waveform is made of 6 half cosine segments. 6 levels and 3 *duty cycle* ratios control the waveform. It is capable of sort of phase distortion sounds.
* [coseg sqr](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/69) A low CPU and antialiased square wave generator with PWM and brilliance control.
* [SelfPM](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/23) This low CPU oscillator generates bandlimited saw-ish and squar-ish waveforms. The bandwidth can be modulated.
* [SelfPMSync](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/48) Includes a master oscillator for sync effects.
* [DevilSync](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/55) A special waveform with embedded master osc for evil sync sounds. First order DPW anti aliasing.
*[KWSync](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/65) A variation of the DevilSync. First order DPW anti aliasing.
* [DP2Saw and DP2PWM](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/6) A saw oscillator and a PWM oscillator. Anti aliasing by second order differentiated polynomials.
* [DP2SawPls and DP2Pulsaw](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/7) These oscillators waveforms are intermediate between saw and pulses. The first harmonics are stronger than the usual saw oscillators. Anti aliasing by second order differentiated polynomials.
* Steps/[SixSteps and SixStepsBLI](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/13) These oscillators are reminiscent of old pseudo digital synths.
* Steps/**SixSteps** is anti aliased by _second order differentiated polynomials_ -> smoother sounds, no ringing, better if used in distortions. * Steps/**SixStepsBLI** is anti aliased by _band limited impulses_ -> brighter sounds, [Gibbs ringing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibbs_phenomenon), beware of artefacts in distortions.
* Steps/[SixStepsSync and SixStepsBLISync](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/15) These include a master and slave osc scheme to recreate hard sync sounds. Try the help patches to get an idea ;).
* Steps/[SixStepsBLIV1 and SixStepsBLIV2](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/27) A hint of imperfection for a more "brassy" sound :trumpet: * Steps/FiveSteps and Steps/SevenSteps These oscillators waveforms consists of five and seven steps. The main interest of each is there particular and distinctive sound caused by the absence of harmonic 5 for the first and harmonic 7 for the second. They particularly blend well with each other as detuned oscillators.
----- ###The 12Steps series of oscillators and the wf_12 companion objects
* wf12/[O2_12StepsSync and wf_12Steps, wf_12Harm and wf_12Bank](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/16) O2_12StepsSync is a twelve step oscillator with master / slave units. The waveform is provided by one of its companion objects **wf_12Steps**, **wf_12Harm** or **wf_12Bank**.
* wf12/[12StepsBLISync](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/25) 12StepsBLISync is a twelve step oscillator with master / slave units (like O2_12StepsSync). It is antialiased with Band Limited Impulses that guaranties brightness and anti-aliasing even at high pitches. The waveform is provided by one of its companion objects **wf_12Steps**, **wf_12Harm** or **wf_12Bank**.
* wf12/12StepsBLI It is similar to 12StepsBLISync but without the master/slave sync facility.
* wf12/[wf_12Chorus](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/26) This object manipulates a wf_12 before it gets used by a 12Steps oscillator. The processing modulates the waveform to create sort of chorus.
* wf12/[wf_12Scale](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/28) This object dynamically time scales a wf_12 before it gets used by a 12Steps oscillator. The resulting effect can be surprising.
----- ###The 16StepsDP2 oscillator and the wf_16 companion objects * wf16/16StepsDP2 It is an anti aliased oscillator based on 16 segments waveforms. The trick is that the segments do not need to be "connected". The end of a segment do not need to match the start of another: **discontinuities** are allowed and the add a bunch of harmonics ! * wf16/wf_16Steps This object allows to create a 16-step-discontinuous waveform to be used by 16StepsDP2
* wf16/[wf_16BankPwr](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/35)
is a bank of 16 predefined waveforms. These waveforms may seem strange at first sight, but they have quite useful spectra for substractive synthesis and are crest factor optimised.
* wf16/[wf_16_harm](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/45) 8 harmonics + interpolation mode (revert -> steps -> linear).
---- ###Oscs In dev...
* Wave3b A complex wave generator with anti aliased phase modulation.
* Osc Bnk I A paraphonic oscillator bank with a wide choice of waveform. Designed for String machines (re)creation.
* Osc_Bnk_I_lock A paraphonic oscillator bank with a wide choice of waveform. Designed for String machines (re)creation. The octave related notes are phase locked. ------ ###tiar/schedule Schedulers are trig units that allows sub krate schedule of lengthy operations such as DP2 pre integration. Use outputs with "update" inputs of modules.
* sc4 A 4 step cyclic scheduler. ------ ###tiar/spat
* [pan m](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/78): A pan with constant gain^2 law. ------ ###tiar/tuning
* [DetHz](http://community.axoloti.com/t/tiar-smashedtransistors-contributions/2737/44) A frequency detuner - as opposed to *pitch detune* - to get consistent doubling of osc all over the keyboard. * DetHzLH Frequency detuner with settings for low, mid and high notes. * Exact5th Allows to retune to exact 5ths instead of exact 8ves.

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/lfo/pink triphase u

A triphase LFO especially designed for chorus fx.

  • The waveforms are made of the superposition of 5 sinusoÃ¯ds roughly octave related (so that the lfo waveforms evolve).
  • The sinusoÃ¯ds are 120Â° rotated on each output.

When used to modulate delay lines, it allows nice and smooth chorus effects.

see for a simple example of chorus fx :
Help->Library->community->tiar->lfo->pink triphase u

tiar/lfo/pink quintphase u

for even fatter chorus

pink quintphase u.PNG1116x630 53.5 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/fx/pitchoct

A simple up octave pitch shifter designed for shimmer effects.
see for a simple exemple :
Help->Library->community->tiar->fx->pitchoct

Edit
I added pitchfifth and pitchX3 with shimmer oriented help patches.
It's time for me for some vacation, see you in three weeks!

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/osc/spectral and spectral2

see help patch in Menu Help -> library -> community -> tiar -> osc -> spectral and spectral2

These oscillators are loosely inspired by the Clavia Nord Modular "spectral oscillator".
They provide very rich signals based on synched pseudo random generators (richer than classic waveforms).

spectral

  • first order antialiasing (integration though box window)
  • very low CPU (~300 CPU cycles per buffer)

spectral2

  • second order aliasing limitation (integration though triangle window)
  • 7 waveform types:
    • 0 all
    • 1 squarish
    • 2 33%
    • 3 25%
    • 4 20%
    • 5 1/6
    • 6 1/7
  • moderate CPU (~1100cycles per buffer)

spectral.PNG603x746 83.1 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @Janko Jack
item.description:
@Janko wrote:

Fantastic! So great to finally have a multiplexing option for us non-coding dummies, thx heaps

Is it possible to just use wire up one 4051 with Ctrl2_4051 without impacting how the object works? And if not do you essentially send S0, S1, and S2 to the same axoloti pins from both/all 4051's?

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/osc/supersaw

see help patch in Menu Help -> library -> community -> tiar -> osc -> supersaw

  • seven detuned saw wave oscillators
  • compatible with the factory osc/supersaw
    • Lower and constant CPU cycles
    • aliasing limitation by Differentiated Polynomials.

supersaw.PNG1182x626 47.8 KB

I added a second Order Polynomial Differentiator anti aliasing algorithm. It uses more CPU but the anti aliasing is more efficient. You can use this option if you need to play high pitches without digital artefacts.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/pata/reed

Pata-physical modelling for reed instrument sounds

see help patch in Menu Help -> library -> community -> tiar -> pata -> reed
Use a modulation wheel (or a breath controller) to control the volume (if you only play notes, you won't have any sound).

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/gain/limiter and limiter st

2 new versions with unprocessed outputs

see help patch in Menu Help -> library -> community -> tiar -> gain -> limiter unproc

The limiters induce a 32 sample delay, so mixing the unprocessed signals with the processed signals lead to unwanted comb filtering.

These limiters offers "unprocessed - yet delayed - outputs".

Mixing unprocessed and limited signals allows to make simple compressors (see help patches).

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/gain/limiter and limiter st

see help patch in Menu Help -> library -> community -> tiar -> gain -> limiter

Easy to use limiters with controlled input gain (1 to 8).
"limiter st" is the stereo version that preserves pan.

They induce 32 sample delay (this internal delay allows me to use a slightly smoothed limitation and to avoid crest distortions/glitches).

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/HW/Ctrl3_4051

see help patch in Menu Help -> library -> community -> tiar -> HW -> Ctrl3_4051

This object uses 3 4051 multiplexers to read 24 pots with only 6 GPIOs.
It includes 24 "smart" smoothers designed for pots.
(they are smart as they remove noise when the pot is rotated smoothly but they jump to values when pots are turned fast, thus, no noisy pots and no 'limp pot' syndrome).

Ctrl3_4051.PNG717x480 35.2 KB

  • Z0 Z1 Z2 are the common Z pin from the 4051s (their Y0..Y7 go to the pots)
  • S0 S1 S2 are the select inputs to the 4051s (the 3 4051s are addressed the same way).
    Note: sometimes S0 S1 S2 are labelled A B C.

[Edit] may 25
I added Ctrl2_4051 that handles two 4051 for (16 pots 5 GPIOs) and Ctrl4_4051 that handles four 4051 (32 pots 7 GPIOs).

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

tiar/delay/over1tap, over3tap and over5tap

See the help patches: Menu Help -> Library -> community -> tiar -> delay
-> over1tap : flanger example
-> over3tap and over5tap : chorus examples

For my string machine i needed some nice chorus effect.

The usual delay lines introduce a variable low pass filter due to linear interpolation.
The trick I use here, consists internally oversampling the delay line so that the "reader" interpolation low pass filter effect would be less prominent.

The over1tap, over3tap and over5tap are single and multitap delays with internal x2 oversampling.
The "Over" attribute can change the type of internal oversampling.

  • "Smooth" : "equalised" low pass input for a vintage sound
  • "Normal" : the usual scheme with its drawback (variable LP filtering)
  • "Bright" : optimal FIR filter for a modern sound

They are handy for chorus and flanger designs.

Note: the delay controls d1... d5 are internally interpolated and smoothed (1st order LP) at audio rate.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiar / SmashedTransistors Contributions
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

I don't use the same algorithm as the streichfett with this object (the streichfett uses BLITs, here I use differentiation).

Each oscillator has an individual Attack Release envelope.

All the parameters can be controlled with control signals (it is handy when you use GPIOs with pots).

4 8 16 feet : mixture control
Attack Release: attack and release time. One AR envelope per oscillator
RevLevel RevDuration: for pseudo Reverberation (in fact, it is a slow secondary AR envelope on each oscillator)
Vibrato : controls the vibrato depth
lfo : is the input for an lfo.

Read full topic
